name: Wrongtom Meets Deemas J "In East London" LP + 7" + CD
description:
Format: Vinyl Album + 7" + CD
Number of discs: 3
Release date: 24 September 2012

Released on Tru Thoughts in 2012, the 1st original LP from the Wrongtom Meets projects pits Tom's vintage dancehall and dub production against Deemas J's jungle informed sound system chit chat.

Championed by almost everyone on BBC6, described as "the strongest modern reggae set to emerge from the UK for many years" by The Wire, and simply "perfect" by Q magazine, and featuring stunning artwork by reggae cover artist extraordinaire Tony McDermott, there's no good reason why you shouldn't own this album.

This version comes as a single vinyl LP, 7" and CD

name: Wrongtom Meets Deemas J "In East London" CD
description:
Format: CD Album
Number of discs: 1
Release date: 24 September 2012

Released on Tru Thoughts in 2012, the 1st original LP from the Wrongtom Meets projects pits Tom's vintage dancehall and dub production against Deemas J's jungle informed sound system chit chat.

Championed by almost everyone on BBC6, described as "the strongest modern reggae set to emerge from the UK for many years" by The Wire, and simply "perfect" by Q magazine, and featuring stunning artwork by reggae cover artist extraordinaire Tony McDermott, there's no good reason why you shouldn't own this album.

name: Mark Professor - Oystah Card 7"
description:
Sold out but you can still grab the single digitally via...

itunes: https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/oystah-card-single/id700734370

Juno: http://www.junodownload.com/products/mark-professor-oystah-card/2292014-02/

Format: Vinyl 7" single
Number of discs: 1
Release date: 26 August 2013

The debut single from MC Mark Professor takes us on a bumpy ride across London from zones 1 to 4 in this paean to the capitol's handy Oystah Card.

“As a card carrying member and a bass-line defender I can highly recommend Mark Professor’s Oystah Card....Top Up!” Don Letts (BBC 6music)

"An original, unique flavour." David Rodigan (BBC 1Xtra)

“Sweet Smiley Culture style celebration of modern mobility.” John Kennedy (Xfm)

name: Spiky Dread: Issue One (CD)
description:
Format: CD Album
Number of discs: 1
Release date: 17 December 2012

14 tracks of punky reggae and post-punk dub handpicked by Wrongtom & Ed Zed featuring liner notes by Ed and the legendary punk professor Vivien Goldman.

Only 1000 copies of the CD, never to be repressed and not available to download, so grab yourself a little piece of skanky history while you still can.

preview the album here http://soundcloud.com/wrongtom/spiky-dread-issue-one-album

Track Listing

1. The Offs - Cool Down 
2. Glaxo Babies - Who Killed Bruce Lee (Version) 
3. Family Fodder - Bass Adds Bass 
4. Chantage - Same Thing Twice 
5. Ruts DC - Pleasures Of The Dance 
6. Jah Scouse – Merge 
7. Peter & The Test Tube Babies - Trapper Aint Got A Bird 
8. Return Of The Panthers - Calling Captain Nemo 
9. Sir Horatio – Sommadub 
10. Red Beat - More Or Less Cut 
11. Dangerous Girls - Dangerous Girls 
12. Bad Brains - Stay Close To Me 
13. The Slits - Animal Space 
14. Electric Guitars – Work [CD ONLY]
